alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 1:21AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, western Pulaski and southwestern McCreary Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 121 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Campbellsville to Jamestown to 8 miles west of Byrdstown. Movement was northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts between 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Faubush around 130 AM EDT. Magnum, Cains Store, Pointer and Sunnybrook around 135 AM EDT. Zula, Susie, Hidalgo, Cabell, Powersburg, Stab, Hogue and Slickford around 140 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Monticello, Parnell, Cooper, Steubenville and Oil Valley. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 22. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
